draw.mission_task_and_description: Killer Troop conducts short range marksmanship on RNG 114 14-15MAR24

values: Proper uniform: Full Dragoon Standard for qualification.
Thorough safety briefing for both firers and range safeties.
Qualified combat Lifesaver/Medic will know MEDEVAC procedures.
PCIs will be conducted prior to entering range. Range safeties will be on lanes.
Leaders, Range OIC/RSO, SMs on lane safety.
Brief procedures for malfunction/misfire, conduct proper PMI and concurrent training.
Ensure weapons and ammo are clean before use .
Safety Brief, Proper PMI training, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/RSO, SMs
Brief range limits and cease fire procedures movement down range will be controlled by the range safeties
Shooters will move down Range on line controlled by safeties. There will be one safety per shooter to ensure control.
Safety brief, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/RSO, SMs
Safeties check for hearing protection, to ensure Troopers have standard issue protection or they will be provided hearing protection prior to firing weapon.
PCCs/PCIs, Extra Hearing Protection available at range, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/RSO, SMs
Firers will wear approved ballistic eye wear while at the range to preventexpelled brass, dirt, dust, and debris from damaging their eyes
PCIs, Lane Safeties, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/RSO, SMs
Ammo will not be placed on the ground, provide adequate guards for ammo while range is not occupied.
All ammo handling procedures will be followed for transport, storage, and distribution.
Range Safety Brief, PCC/PCI
Leaders, Range OIC/RSO, SMs
Leaders will ensure weather conditions are favorable for usage of tracers. People and Equipment on standby to respond. Positive communications with Range Control.
Inspect conditions down range, call the range maester, follow proper fire response procedures
Leaders, Range OIC/RSO, SMs
Follow procedures when loading, firing, and unloading weapons
Remind Soldiers to consider weapons loaded at all times and to check chambers often.
Safety Brief
Safety Brief, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/RSO, SMs
Range will cease fire with severe weather. Range OIC will contact GTA range operations desk if the weather is called into question
Safety Brief, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/RSO, SMs

Convoy Leaders will give ramp brief prior to movement. Vehicle Crews will wear all required PPE while operating tactical vehicles. Vehicles will follow range roads and use ground guides in parking areas.
Ramp Brief, Proper PPE, Ground Guides, Follow Roads
Vehicle Crews, Convoy Leaders, Gate Guard, RSO
